title: Slope-n-Out
desc: Athletes use sloper pad to hold a front swing, then pushing off their backswing, they pull the cliffs and swing through to saftey.

title: Tippy Cliff
desc: It's a cliff that tips! The hub has a locking mechanism made out of AR500 steel. With this, the cliff can start vertical and fall, locking itself into a normal cliff position.

title: Flick Up
desc: Like a sideways board, but better! Flick up includes two 30 degree sloped sides that can be used as a more challenging sideways board. Also, the name flick up comes with the signature move performed as the athlete 'flicks up' on a side to catch the hidden slot-cliff that comes at them. With so many possiblities, it's hard to not love the flicks!

title: Garage Door
desc: With the famous slot grab, ninja has evolved greatly (thanks Brett Sims). However, making the slot dynamic has never made its impact. With the Garage Door, athletes are challenged to lead with one hand into a small, 4.5 inch wide gap to pull the door down for the comfort of both hands.

title: S-Hook
desc: Making its first appearance at the January WNL held at Action Norwood, the S-Hook is the only obstacle to force a big superman move! No matter how you try and get out of it, you need to embrace your super powers and fly!

title: The Ghost
desc: With pacman of course comes the ghosts. Chasing the chompers down, the ghosts are the most fearful part. This ghost features angled sides for an easy hang while adding angled slots for a harder grab. The cliff hangers on each side let the athlete flip the ghost upside down to earn 100 points and some style.

title: Tiki
desc: Designed with bolt cutters in mind, this Tiki is always having a good time. Making its first apperance at an Action Norwood WNL, the Tiki challenges competitors to snag its last tooth with bolt cutters making for a fun precision challenge.

title: Diamond Ring
desc: The Diamond Ring is almost too beautiful for the sport of ninja. Being able to magnetize sideways to a bar, the Diamond Ring has infinite possibilities!

title: Mustache
desc: This Mustache isn't hairy, it's made with comfort in mind. Used for flipping, this Mustache took the world by storm in late January. Yes, this obstacle was called 'Flippin' Stash'.

title: On-n-Off
desc: Just a basic board with bearings, yes. Not the most complex, however the use case is quite fun. Already being in a WNL course this past February, it is guaranteed that once you get on top of the slanted board, you are in for a wild jump backwards and huge swing through.

title: Push Cliff
desc: Wait!? Its a cliff!? But it's hidden! I guess you must push to reveal!

title: Grappling Hook
desc: Want to be Batman? Use this to throw, latch, and swing to your most desired places in town (or on the ninja course).

title: Locksmith
desc: Instead of an easy link, this obstacle requires you to shove the two cliffs forwards, to unlock your way to victory!

title: Cage
desc: Just like a shark cage, this one will protect you. The only catch is that this one might also give you nightmares. Using this with bolt cutters is possible on the metal standoffs and a single hand slot grab is in the bottom. Finally, Stage 4 Designs T-handles fit right in the bottom with a small twist!
